title.rendered: Perth vs Brisbane, Final, Australian T20 League 2022: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Perth: Cameron Bancroft, Stephen Eskinazi, Aaron Hardie, Josh Inglis (wk), Ashton Turner (c), Nick Hobson, Cooper Connolly, Andrew Tye, David Payne, Jason Behrendorff, Matthew Kelly/Peter Hatzoglou

Brisbane: Sam Heazlett, Josh Brown, Nathan McSweeney, Sam Hain, Jimmy Peirson (c, wk), Max Bryant, James Bazley, Michael Neser, Xavier Bartlett, Spencer Johnson, Matt Kuhnemann

Pitch Report

Venue: Perth Stadium, Perth

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 170

2nd innings average score: 174

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Perth batters have made merry at their home ground this season. While Cameron Bancroft averages 114 in 5 games, Ashton Turner (274 runs) and Aaron Hardie (272 runs) have been doing the bulk of the scoring in the middle overs.

To further strengthen Hardie’s case, his scores against Brisbane in the league stage read 57 off 33 and 67 off 35.

Andrew Tye has had an incredible time collecting wickets at Perth. In 8 matches, he has sniped up 14 wickets at a strike rate of 13. He is also the highest wicket-taker in the contests between these teams.

David Payne has been selected by an average of 18% players in the last 5 games, but he made it to the Ultimate Team in all the outings, overall managing 9 wickets. To put it simply, he has been a dark horse in fantasy leagues.

Jason Behrendorff has gone wicketless only once in the last 10 matches, taking 13 wickets in total.

Michael Neser has provided a three-wicket haul bonus as many as five times and a 30-run bonus twice this season.

The pitch is a batting beauty so much so that 9 fifties were scored in the last 3 games.
